intro: Calotheca barbata, commonly known as the hairy calotheca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are usually hairy, giving it the common name, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. Calotheca barbata is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
